name: PogoStickMiooooooon
description:
What is "PogoStickMiooooooon"

"PogoStickMiooooooon" is a hololive fangame featuring Ookami Mio, member of Hololive Gamers.

The game is a platform action with you control Ookami Mio who jump automatically on a pogo stick. Jumping to the platforms, and just keep going up, don't fall.

How To Play


  • Left Mouse Button: Decide
  • A Key/Left Arrow Key: Move Left
  • D Key/Right Arrow Key: Move Right
  • Left Thumbstick/D-Pad: Move Left-Right

Jumping to the platforms, and keep going up higher and higher.
When it lands on the platform, it automatically jumps, don't panic.
NON STOP HOLOLIVE!

There is no goal.
It is a score attack to see how high you can go up.

Streaming Notice

This game is available for streaming.

And we'd be very grateful if you could help us with the following!
  • Include "PogoStickMiooooooon" in the stream title.
  • Include a link to this page in the stream description.

This game is a fiction featuring talents from Hololive Production. This is not an official game of Cover Corporation and Hololive Production.
Please stream the game while being respectful of the characters. If your stream or video is leads to grieving to the talent, I may reach out and request for the video to be removed.

Excuse

Please try to understand the circumstances.

  • Assumed play time is 5~10 minutes small volume.
  • The resolution is fixed at 450x800. Please make sure that the height is within the display.
  • Sound volume cannot be set in the game.
  • High scores cannot be save.
  • There is no function to post scores to social networking sites.
  • The UI cannot be controlled with the gamepad.

Credits

Game Design/Art/Engineering/Title Logo/Publishing, almost all of them: Blasthal

Sound: A lots of free sounds

Synopsis

"The entrance to the fortune-telling house is blocked!"

Ookami Mio has been locked out of the fortune-telling house she went to so much trouble to build. The staff-only entrance was also blocked. The remaining entrance is on the roof.
A white fox girl gave her pogo stick, a familiar platform floating in the air, and I decided to do it.
But was the fortune-telling house so tall ...?

Disclaimer

This non-commercial game is a derivative work with the talents of Cover Corporation's Hololive Production.

This game is not endorsed by or directly affiliated with Cover Corporation or Hololive Production.
The game is produced according to Cover Corporation's Derivative Work License Agreement.
